public:
catalog open( const std::string&amp; name, const std::locale&amp; loc ) const;

{{dcl|num=2|1=

@1@ Public member function, calls the protected virtual member function {{tt|do_open}} of the most derived class.

@2@ Obtains a value of type {{tt|catalog}} (inherited from {{lc|std::messages_base}}), which can be passed to {{lc|get()}} to retrieve messages from the message catalog named by {{c|name}}. This value is usable until passed to {{lc|close()}}.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|name|name of the message catalog to open}}
{{par|loc|a locale object that provides additional facets that may be required to read messages from the catalog, such as {{lc|std::codecvt}} to perform wide/multibyte conversions}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
The non-negative value of type {{tt|catalog}} that can be used with {{lc|get()}} and {{lc|close()}}. Returns a negative value if the catalog could not be opened.

===Notes===
On POSIX systems, this function call usually translates to a call to {{tt|[https://pubs.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/9699919799/functions/catopen.html catopen()]}}. In GNU libstdc++, it calls {{tt|[https://gcc.gnu.org/onlinedocs/libstdc++/manual/facets.html textdomain]}}. 

The actual catalog location is implementation-defined: for the catalog {{c|"sed"}} (message catalogs installed with the Unix utility {{tt|'sed'}}) in German locale, for example, the file opened by this function call may be {{tt|/usr/lib/nls/msg/de_DE/sed.cat}}, {{tt|/usr/lib/locale/de_DE/LC_MESSAGES/sed.cat}}, or {{tt|/usr/share/locale/de/LC_MESSAGES/sed.mo}}.
